Description: Pot, sherbet? cup (and lid); made of earthenware; a) pot with flat base, rounded sides, curved handle on one side, decorated with curvilinear designs; b) lid with knob at centre, decorated with curvilinear designs.
Curator's comments: Probably acquired by Henry Christy on his visit to the Eastern Mediterranean in 1850. The slip suggests that this is a sherbet cup and refers to Lane's 'Modern Egypt' vol.I p.207.
